member.name: IMemInputPin.GetAllocator

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetAllocator method retrieves the memory allocator proposed by this pin. After the allocator has been selected, this method returns a pointer to the selected allocator.

member.param: Receives a pointer to the allocator's interface. The caller must release the interface.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include those shown in the following table.

member.name: IMemInputPin.GetAllocatorRequirements

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetAllocatorRequirements method retrieves the allocator properties requested by the input pin.

member.param: Pointer to an , structure which is filled in with the requirements.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include those shown in the following table.

member.name: IMemInputPin.NotifyAllocator

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . The NotifyAllocator method specifies an allocator for the connection.

member.param: Flag that specifies whether samples from this allocator are read-only. If TRUE, samples are read-only.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful, or an HRESULT value indicating the cause of the error.

The Receive method receives the next media sample in the stream.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include those shown in the following table.

The ReceiveCanBlock method determines whether calls to the method might block.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include those shown in the following table.

listheader.description: The pin will not block on a call to Receive
The pin might block on a call to Receive.

member.name: IMemInputPin.ReceiveMultiple

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. The ReceiveMultiple method receives multiple samples in the stream.

member.param: Address of an array of interface pointers, of size nSamples.
Pointer to a variable that receives the number of samples that were processed.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include those shown in the following table.

listheader.description: Pin is currently flushing; sample was rejected.

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]

The IMemInputPin interface delivers media data to an input pin. Input pins expose this interface if they use the interface to allocate buffers. When an output pin connects to an input pin, the output pin uses this interface to negotiate allocator requirements and deliver samples to the input pin.
Applications typically do not use this interface.
Filter developers:The CBaseInputPin class implements this interface.
